Chart-Name: Percentage of residents who say that climate change is important to them
CSV-File: % of residents who say that climate change is important to them.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI shows how residents view climate change. This can help to understand the role and support of residents along Lambeth's climate journey.

Chart-Name: Percentage of domestic buildings in the borough reaching EPC C or above
CSV-File: % of domestic buildings in the borough reaching EPC C or above.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI helps us track our performance in improving the energy efficiency of domestic buildings. Using EPC data as a proxy for energy efficiency across buildings.

Chart-Name: Percentage of non-domestic buildings in the borough reaching EPC rated C or above
CSV-File: % of non-domestic buildings in the borough reaching EPC rated C or above.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI helps us track our performance in improving the energy efficiency of non-domestic buildings. Using EPC data as a proxy for energy efficiency across buildings.

Chart-Name: Total non-domestic gas consumption across borough
CSV-File: Total non-domestic gas consumption across borough.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI gives us an indication of how Lambeth is progressing towards fossil fuel free heating in non-domestic properties. As such, reduction in per capita gas consumption suggests that energy efficiency is improving, and gas reliance is decreasing.

Chart-Name: Number of Households with solar panels
CSV-File: Number of Households with solar panels.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI allows us to monitor installed solar capacity within the domestic sector.

Chart-Name: Number of active car club members
CSV-File: Number of active car club members.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI highlights how residents are rethinking their car use and ownership. Car club membership shows a shift away from private ownership and reduce private vehicle use.

Chart-Name: Percentage of transport journeys in Lambeth made by walking, cycling, or public transport
CSV-File: % of transport journeys in Lambeth made by walking, cycling, or public transport.csv
Chart-Description: The percentage of transport journeys made in Lambeth by walking, cycling and public transport is a key measure to monitor Lambeth's progress towards at least 85% of journeys in Lambeth being made by walking, cycling or other public transport modes by 2030.

Chart-Name: Percentage of people regularly walking or cycling
CSV-File: % of people regularly walking or cycling.csv
Chart-Description: The % of people walking and cycling is a proxy for reduce vehicle use and how public habits and modes of transport are changing within the borough.

Chart-Name: Percentage of all vehicles that are plug in electric
CSV-File: % of all vehicles that are plug in electric.csv
Chart-Description: % of vehicles that are plug in electric shows how resident transportation is changing in the borough. Higher % of EV's shows a reduced reliance on ICE vehicles.

Chart-Name: Tonnage of household waste per household
CSV-File: Tonnage of household waste per household.csv
Chart-Description: Monitoring this KPI provides an estimation of Lambeth household consumption and subsequent disposal habits. As such, this will allow future monitoring of Lambeth behaviour change and progress to meeting the Lambeth CAP goal of a 2/3rds reduction in consumption by 2030.

Chart-Name: Tonnage of non-household waste
CSV-File: Tonnage of non-household waste.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI allows for the further monitoring of progress towards reducing non-household waste, such as from shops, restaurants and public sector bodies. This KPI will allow for us to see progress towards Lambeth's CAP goal of reducing consumption by 2/3rds by 2030.

Chart-Name: Percentage of household waste sent to recycling/reuse
CSV-File: % of household waste sent to recycling-reuse.csv
Chart-Description: The percentage of household waste being sent to recycling / reuse is a metric that will indicate how Lambeth is progressing towards a circular economy. Additionally, this contributes to Lambeth reducing consumption by 2/3rds by 2030.

Chart-Name: Percentage of non-household waste sent for recycling/reuse
CSV-File: % of non-household waste sent for recycling-reuse.csv
Chart-Description: The percentage of non-household waste being sent to recycling / reuse is a metric that will indicate how Lambeth is progressing towards a circular economy.

Chart-Name: Percentage of developments built on previously non-developed land
CSV-File: % of developments built on previously non-developed land.csv
Chart-Description: Monitoring the percentage of new residential builds constructed on green space will show how much green coverage will have been lost. This metric shows how well we are doing in encouraging and ensuring as many developments as possible take place on brownfield sites.

Chart-Name: Annual territorial emissions (KtCO2e)
CSV-File: Annual territorial emissions (KtCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: Total kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted in Lambeth, is the best measure of Lambeth Borough's contribution to the UK's emissions.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions per capita
CSV-File: Annual emissions per capita (tCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: This KPI details the total tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted in Lambeth per capita, is a measure of emissions per resident in Lambeth.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for commercial buildings
CSV-File: Annual emissions for commercial buildings (ktCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: Total kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted from Lambeth Borough commercial buildings. This KPI highlights emissions contribution from shops, offices, depots etc.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for domestic buildings
CSV-File: Annual emissions for domestic buildings (ktCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: Total kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted from Lambeth Borough domestic buildings. This KPI highlights the emissions impact from all houses in the borough.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for public sector buildings
CSV-File: Annual emissions for public sector buildings (ktCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: This KPI highlights the total kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted from Lambeth Borough's industrial sector, showing the contribution our industry makes to total Lambeth emissions.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for the industrial sector
CSV-File: Annual emissions for the industrial sector (ktCO2e).csv
Chart-Description: This KPI details the total Kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted across public services.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for the transport sector
CSV-File: Annual emissions for the transport sector.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI details the total Kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted from transport across Lambeth, this includes all road and train travel.

Chart-Name: Annual emissions for waste management
CSV-File: Annual emissions for waste management.csv
Chart-Description: This KPI provides data on the total Kilotonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted from Lambeth Borough's waste management practises, such as landfill.
